titles.title: Tokyo Ghoul:Re (2018)
东京喰种:re (2018)
東京喰種[トーキョーグール]:re (2018)
도쿄 구울:RE (2018)
东京喰种:re 第二季

recommendations.recommendation: Its a decent ending to this series. However, I feel like there were too many characters and the plot was all over the place. Season 3 & 4 were a big dissappointment compared to the first 2 seasons. Recommended only for some sort of ending. :D

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch72229 [Kaneki Ken] has finally regained memories of his former self, but this once again leaves him at a crossroads in the war between human and http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul]. After donning a pair of glasses to mirror his mentor http://anidb.net/ch98685 [Arima], http://anidb.net/ch98684 [Kaneki]`s new assignment is to manage the interrogation of http://anidb.net/ch98561 [Eto], the http://anidb.net/ch95884 [One-Eyed Owl], after she reveals her ghoul nature in a press conference about the publication of her newest book, which she claims will bridge the gap between the two warring sides. Now interred in http://anidb.net/ch95846 [Cochlea], Eto eagerly awaits the awakening of the "One-Eyed King", but only Kaneki seems to understand what she`s really planning. As http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree] descends on the facility to rescue their leader, Kaneki turns to one of his oldest friends for help in his new secret mission. Source: ANN Note: The first episode received a pre-airing online via GYAO! and Docomo Anime Store on 29.09.2018. The regular TV broadcast started on 09.10.2018.

externalentity.identifier: 東京喰種トーキョーグール

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: collateral damage
tag.description: The usually action orientated anime does not only show large amounts of combat and weapon use, but also the incidental massive destruction of property, often due to the inability of the protagonists to aim properly. Example: Mecha duking it out in a densely populated urban area.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: prison
tag.description: A building used to house convicted criminals and accused persons.

tag.name: human enhancement
tag.description: Human enhancement can take various forms: It can be something comparatively non-intrusive as a power-up drug, a form of machine implantation or cyberization (http://anidb.net/a4414 [SAC Solid State Society]), or outright - possibly atrocious - genetic manipulation (http://anidb.net/a361 [Ao no 6 Gou]). Plot-wise enhanced protagonists in anime usually have to pay a price for their enhancements, be it physical or mental.

tag.name: alternative present
tag.description: Anime that fit in the alternative present category usually have technology and society that is very similar to ours, but with differences in both, history and culture, which sometimes are blatantly obvious, but sometimes harder to place; this one can at times be very subjective.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Tokyo
tag.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government. Tokyo is in the Kantou region on the southeastern side of the main island Honshu and includes the Izu Islands and Ogasawara Islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: sex
tag.description: Sexual intercourse, the ultimate bond of love and the "Origin of the World" (just think of Gustave Courbet`s painting: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L%27Origine_du_monde). Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: slow when it comes to love
tag.description: The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love. In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: horror
tag.description: The horror cinematic genre is characterized by the attempt to make the viewer experience dread, fear, terror, or horror. Often their plots involve the intrusion of an evil force, event or personage, sometimes of supernatural origin, on the mundane world and the consequences thereof.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: dystopia
tag.description: A dystopia (from Ancient Greek: δυσ-, "bad, ill", and Ancient Greek: τόπος, "place, landscape"; alternatively cacotopia, or anti-utopia) is, in literature, an often futuristic society that has degraded into a repressive and controlled state, often under the guise of being utopian. Dystopian literature has underlying cautionary tones, warning society that if we continue to live how we do, this will be the consequence. A dystopia, thus, is regarded as a sort of negative utopia and is often characterized by an authoritarian or totalitarian form of government. Dystopias usually feature different kinds of repressive social control systems, a lack or total absence of individual freedoms and expressions and constant states of warfare or violence. Dystopias often explore the concept of humans abusing technology and how humans individually and collectively cope with technology that has evolved too quickly such as the car, the flamethrower or the microwave. A dystopian society is also often characterized by widespread poverty and brutal political controls such as a large military-like police.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: genetic modification
tag.description: Story-wise, genetic modification is usually centred on humans, probably the most subtle and creepy way of messing with mankind. Playing with the fear of the unknown, genetically altered humans are technically a new species, that may not only surpass but actually replace unaltered humans. The level of modification will vary from subtle changes in "look" (e.g. super-human beauty), to mental enhancements (PSI powers), to more or less atrocious adaptations to extreme environments (breath under water, radiation resistance). Note that changes in Aliens would be difficult to pinpoint, after all they are alien.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: rotten world
tag.description: A rotten world is a setting or situation where the jaded notion that "anything that can go wrong will go horribly wrong" almost always applies. Oppression, perpetual warfare, lawlessness, despair or other forms of mental instability, and other highly undesirable factors tend to be rampant.

tag.name: mutilation
tag.description: Mutilation is an act of physical injury that degrades the appearance or function of any living body. Some ethnic groups practice ritual mutilation, e.g. scarification, burning, flagellation(whipping), tattooing, or wheeling, as part of a rite of passage. In some cases, the term may apply to treatment of dead bodies, such as soldiers mutilated after they have been killed by an enemy. Maiming, or mutilation which involves the loss of, or incapacity to use, a bodily member, is and has been practised by many societies with various cultural and religious significances, and is also a customary form of physical punishment, especially applied on the principle of "an eye for an eye". Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: emotions awaken superpowers
tag.description: During an extreme emotional state — rage, love, hate, angst, sadness, compassion — something inside the character will "click" that will increase greatly his/her power or a new superpower awakes, that surpasses anything achieved by him/her until then.

tag.name: Tokyo destroyed
tag.description: Tokyo is depicted as being or having been destroyed, either partially or completely, by some sort of disaster, such as a nuclear blast, a very large-scale fire, or rising sea levels. Should the situation be dire enough, Tokyo may be destroyed again after a recovery, or a new Tokyo may be built and subsequently destroyed, by a new disaster.

tag.name: everybody dies
tag.description: Not necessarily everyone, but a good portion of the characters kick the bucket.

tag.name: eating of humans
tag.description: The eating of humans, also called man-eating, is the practice of some species to prey on human beings for nourishment. Examples of possible hunters may include Earth animals, alien species, zombies or other undead, and so forth. Eating of humans is not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t3815 [human cannibalism]; the former is about other species eating people, while the latter is about humans eating fellow humans.

tag.name: human experimentation
tag.description: Genetic, biological, chemical or psychological experimentation on human beings are portrayed or their aftermath is shown.

tag.name: teamwork
tag.description: A cooperative effort by the members of a group or team to achieve a common goal.

tag.name: fight for peace
tag.description: Don`t they all... The protagonists are trying to ensure long-lasting peace by fighting a vicious enemy, hoping to defeat the threat permanently.

tag.name: saving the world
tag.description: While villains love to take over the world or cause the end of the world as we know it, the heroes are most likely motivated by the polar opposite, saving the world. A fairly simple plot/motivation related to for great justice and what not, this trope is pretty broad and very common for many stories not focused on character interaction only. Source: TV Trope

tag.name: coup d`etat
tag.description: A coup d`état (/ˌkuːdeɪˈtɑː/; French: blow of state; plural: coups d`état), also known as a coup, a putsch, or an overthrow, is the sudden and illegal seizure of a government, usually instigated by a small group of the existing state establishment to depose the established government and replace it with a new ruling body. A coup d`état is considered successful when the usurpers establish their dominance. If a coup fails, a civil war may ensue.

tag.name: drastic change of life
tag.description: One or more characters in this series go through an event that makes them change their way of life drastically and permanently. This change might be voluntary, or against the character`s will. Some examples might be an accident, the gaining of superpowers, or simply graduating.

tag.name: gore
tag.description: A Splatter film or Gore film is a sub-genre of horror film that deliberately focuses on graphic portrayals of gore and graphic violence. These films, through the use of special effects and excessive blood and guts, tend to display an overt interest in the vulnerability of the human body and the theatricality of its mutilation. Due to their willingness to portray images society might consider shocking, splatter films share some ideological grounds with the transgressive art movement. The term "splatter cinema" was coined by George A. Romero to describe his film Dawn of the Dead, though Dawn of the Dead is generally considered by critics to have higher aspirations, such as social commentary, than to be simply exploitative for its own sake. [Source: wiki]

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: suicide
tag.description: One or several characters in this anime commit suicide.

tag.name: defeat means friendship
tag.description: In a series based around an endless series of one-on-one fights, defeating a Worthy Opponent or The Rival will sometimes convert them to the hero`s side, if not always to his cause. Furthermore, no matter how many people the Worthy Opponent has killed, how much grief he has caused, even if he slaughtered helpless children or the hero`s own family, as soon as he shows a bit of remorse or goes out of his way to help the hero even once, he will be welcomed into the hero`s circle of True Companions with open arms. (Source: TVTropes)

tag.name: evil organization
tag.description: The main enemy in this show is an evil organization, that starts off with a small number of unknown goals/powerful members that you learn about as the story goes on. Examples: 1 - Akatsuki from Naruto. 2 - Demon Cards from Rave Master. 3 - Gung-Ho Guns from Trigun.

tag.name: time skip
tag.description: The plot features at least one skip or jump in time. Example: A skip from the present into the past, or time skips in increments, e.g. every hour there is a time skip by a day.

tag.name: fast-paced
tag.description: Hold onto your hats, this anime`s storyline is relentless. The characters don`t get time to take a breath as events keep both them and the viewer on a roller coaster ride of revelation and excitement! Hopefully it all makes sense...

tag.name: nearly almighty protagonist
tag.description: Man 1: "Hey man, did you see me take down that guy over there, there`s no way he could have survived that!" Man 2: "Yeah I know what you mean, it would take the strength of 1 million men to be able to ..... HE`S GETTING BACK UP!!?!?" *synonymous jaws dropping* This anime`s main character is comparable to the gods themselves in terms of resistibility, strength and/or downright bad-assery. Whenever they seem as if the fire inside has burnt out, they rise from the ashes with enough tenacity and ferocity to vanquish any foe that dare stand against them.

tag.name: experimental technology
tag.description: In generic use, experimental technology has not yet been fully proven in operating. Often only a prototype exists that`s being tested.

tag.name: secret organisation
tag.description: A secret organisation or secret society is an organisation whose activities and inner functioning are concealed from non-members. The society may or may not attempt to conceal its existence itself. Examples of historical and existing secret societies include Freemasonry, the Knights Templar, the Rosicrucians, Skull and Bones, the Thule Society, and the Illuminati.

tag.name: experiments
tag.description: Involves (para-)scientific experiments.

tag.name: massacre
tag.description: Mass murder.

tag.name: guns are useless
tag.description: Guns are about as effective as throwing tissue while only manly things like swords, spears, and bare fists are any use at all. If the weapon shoots a projectile faster than human eyes can track, it is useless. Most guns only serve as a filler for the protagonist to dodge all their shots so they can kill them with a "real" weapon. The sniper rifle is an occasional exception to this rule. This is because it can be used to quickly and efficiently reduce the amount of character development the animators have to worry about.

tag.name: power gives you wings
tag.description: It is not Red Bull that gives you wings, but power, most often even the power of love. Whether it`s an android, a mecha, mons, a mahou shoujo, or basically any super powered individual, once they start powering up and become REALLY powerful, it will be indicated by them getting a pair of wings. Specifically, feathery white angelic wings, sometimes also wings made of Hard Light or Pure Energy. These wings will of course allow the character to fly, float, and glow, all without needing to flap them!

tag.name: ass-kicking girls
tag.description: The female characters in the anime are very proficient in some form of martial arts, swordplay, or gunfights. They may also have super powers.

tag.name: misunderstanding
tag.description: Suggests that a large portion of storyline revolves around a rather large misunderstanding between two or more characters, usually forming long lasting situations of separation or hostility between all those involved. A large portion of the story may be dedicated to gradually working all parties into a mutual understanding to true intentions or changes of heart.

tag.name: human - non-human relationship
tag.description: The relationship between a human and a non-human — be it alien, or artificial — is explored in this anime. This usually means between a male human and a female (humanoid) alien or AI (avatar).

tag.name: heroic sacrifice
tag.description: "In order to save the many, the few will need to sacrifice their lives..." or so this character may think. In a seemingly hopeless situation, against impossible odds, the character does not choose the path of the coward and run, he or she chooses to bravely face the enemy, fully aware that this will mean death.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: underground
tag.description: Some or all of the action occurs underground, in caves, mines, sewers, subways or underground cities.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: preaired episodes
tag.description: An anime has preaired episodes when one or more episodes, generally the first ones, were aired ahead of the usual schedule.

character.name: Irimi Kaya
character.description: Irimi Kaya is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] and the former leader of the Black Dobers, known by the alias http://anidb.net/ch95872 [Black Dog]. She was a waitress working at http://anidb.net/ch70053 [Anteiku] before its destruction. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Ghoul Taisaku Kyoku
character.description: The Commission of Counter Ghoul, usually abbreviated as CCG, is a federal agency that serves as a criminal investigative body in cases connected to http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghouls]. The CCG`s headquarters are in the 1st Ward. The ghouls commonly call the http://anidb.net/t7112 [ghoul investigators] Doves, a nickname originating from the CCG`s seal. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Donato Porpora
character.description: Donato Porpora is a powerful Russian http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] captured by http://anidb.net/ch92823 [Urie]`s father and imprisoned by http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG], who once posed as a Catholic priest and raised http://anidb.net/ch66561 [Amon Koutarou]. He is considered a valuable source of information on other ghouls, due to having no loyalty to others. His favorite victims were the orphans he raised. Strangely, he spared Amon after the boy caught him butchering another child. This fact continues to haunt Amon. Once the Cochlea is breached after http://anidb.net/ch92821 [Haise]`s betrayal, he manages to escape and rejoin his fellow Clowns. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Mabuchi Katsuya
character.description: Mabuchi Katsuya is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and is a part of Division II. He is the subordinate of http://anidb.net/ch68707 [Marude Itsuki] and is normally seen standing beside Marude. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Hirako Take
character.description: Hirako Take was a Senior Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] before resigning from the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]. In the past he formed a duo with http://anidb.net/ch70038 [Arima Kishou]. He was in charge of the 21st ward and previously investigated the S-rated ghoul http://anidb.net/ch95690 [Serpent] with http://anidb.net/ch95847 [his squad], but was later transferred to work alongside Arima again. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Kuroiwa Iwao
character.description: Kuroiwa Iwao is a Special Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and an Investigation Commander in Division I. He served as the Vice Commander of the 11th Ward Special Countermeasures Unit, and Vice Commander of Squad 1 during the Owl Suppression Operation. He was seriously wounded during the battle, losing his left hand. Even so, he has managed to continue serving as an investigator and was greatly admired for his charisma. http://anidb.net/ch69927 [Shinohara Yukinori] used to call him by the nickname Iwaccho. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Tanakamaru Mougan
character.description: Tanakamaru Mougan is a Special Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and the Branch Director of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s 2nd Ward Branch Office. He acted as the captain of Squad 2 in the Owl Suppression Operation. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Kamishiro Matasaka
character.description: Kamishiro Matasaka is the former leader of the http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghouls] in the 6th ward. He inherited the surname "Kamishiro" from his mentor. He looked after http://anidb.net/ch65638 [Rize], who was on the run from http://anidb.net/ch98950 [V] at the time, as his foster daughter. Most people refer to him by his nickname Orca or Shachi. He is a strong ghoul, well-versed in the martial arts. When he was the leader of the ghouls in the 6th ward, he trained and strengthened his followers. However, he was captured, due to Rize`s actions, and was sent to http://anidb.net/ch95846 [Cochlea]. However, he was freed during the Second Cochlea Raid, and temporarily joined http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree] after an agreement with http://anidb.net/ch66564 [Yoshimura]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Itou Kuramoto
character.description: Itou Kuramoto is a First-Class Investigator, and member of Hirako`s team. He is easy-going and cheerful, slowly becoming a good friend to http://anidb.net/ch92821 [Sasaki] and the Quinx. After the Auction, he finds himself suddenly given command of the squad and has misgivings about it. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Hachikawa Chuu
character.description: Hachikawa Chuu was an Associate Special Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] from the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]. He was the Captain of the Squad 3 in the Owl Suppression Operation. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Fura Taishi
character.description: Fura Taishi is a First-Class Ghoul Investigator.

character.name: Arima Kishou
character.description: Arima Kishou is a classmate of http://anidb.net/ch76474 [Taishi], http://anidb.net/ch76471 [Aki] and http://anidb.net/ch76473 [Minami]`s, as well as undercover Ghoul Investigator. He was assigned to deal with Lantern in 13th Ward. During the fight with Lantern, Taishi learned about his involvement with Doves and agreed to help him in order to avenge his http://anidb.net/ch76472 [friend]`s death. Later on, Minami joined the team and helped out gathering clues about Ghouls.

character.name: Orochi
character.description: Serpent is a powerful S rank http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] goes around hunting down and killing http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] http://anidb.net/t7112 [investigators] as well as other ghouls. He seems to have a great dislike towards both CCG and http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree] commenting that they are the same and disgusting for creating "fake" ghouls. His kagune is a tail-like formation that wraps around his leg and enhances the strength of his kicks beyond those of his rank. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Saeki Karao
character.description: Saeki Karao, also known as Torso, is a ghoul serial killer who is known for dismembering, then decapitating his victims by only taking their torso, although he only targets females. He was investigated by the CCG`s Mado and Shimoguchi Squads. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kuroiwa Takeomi
character.description: Kuroiwa Takeomi is a Rank 2 Investigator, and member of Team Hirako. He is the son of Special Class http://anidb.net/ch72813 [Kuroiwa Iwao], and considered to be an exceptionally gifted young Investigator. Kuramoto notes that he is among the 0.01% of humans that possesses physical strength above normal human limitations, and can therefore actually fight ghouls unarmed. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kirishima Touka
character.description: After the time skip, Touka is seen running a new coffee shop called http://anidb.net/ch95856 [:Re] with http://anidb.net/ch67129 [Renji]. She also appears to have matured some in that she is calmer and has a less aggressive demeanor than in her teenage years. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kirishima Ayato
character.description: After the time skip, Ayato adopts the identity of Black Rabbit and takes credit for his http://anidb.net/ch95700 [sister]`s crimes. He also becomes http://anidb.net/ch95691 [Hinami]`s partner after she joins the http://anidb.net/ch70052 [organization] and cares deeply for her, to the point of staging an invasion of http://anidb.net/ch95846 [Cochlea] in order to save her from being executed. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Furuta Nimura
character.description: Furuta Nimura is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He was originally Washuu-Furuta Souta, the illegitimate son of former http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] Chairman http://anidb.net/ch96193 [Washuu Tsuneyoshi] and an agent of http://anidb.net/ch98950 [V] raised in the Sunlit Garden. While working as a Rank 1 Ghoul Investigator, he used the alias of Furuta Nimura. To further his own agenda, he has used various identities to infiltrate organizations or build personal alliances. As a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95833 [Clowns], he goes by the name Souta and was responsible for the Steel Beam Incident. He also joined the Ghoul Restaurant as PG, and has been a partner in http://anidb.net/ch68389 [Kanou Akihiro]`s ghoulification experiments. Like http://anidb.net/ch65636 [Kaneki Ken], he is an artificial one-eyed ghoul who possesses http://anidb.net/ch65638 [Kamishiro Rize]`s kagune. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Suzuya Juuzou
character.description: After the time skip, Suzuya Juuzou rises further in the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s ranks and becomes leader of http://anidb.net/ch95743 [his own squad], having matured more thanks to http://anidb.net/ch69927 [Shinohara] and become a responsible, if eccentric, adult. He is promoted to Special Class at the age of 22, the first to reach the rank that young since http://anidb.net/ch70038 [Arima]. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Abara Hanbee
character.description: Abara Hanbee is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s http://anidb.net/ch95743 [Suzuya Squad] and is assigned to the 13th Ward. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Washuu Matsuri
character.description: Washuu Matsuri is the son of http://anidb.net/ch72815 [Washuu Yoshitoki], a Special Class Investigator and a commander in Division II. He distinguished himself while serving in Germany, eliminating the Rosewald Family and rapidly climbing the ranks. He opposes the existence of the Quinx, and treats http://anidb.net/ch92821 [Sasaki] with disrespect. He`s also known for his callous attitude, and his teams taking heavy losses to get the maximum results, seeing them as expendable. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Tsukiyama Mirumo
character.description: Tsukiyama Mirumo is a wealthy and highly-eccentric http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul], well-known within ghoul society for his extravagance. He is the father of http://anidb.net/ch66562 [Tsukiyama Shuu], the once-infamous Gourmet. He deeply loved his wife, who died while their son was still very young. He describes their relationship as having been a passionate romance, and still keeps a place at the table for her. His kindness to his servants and subordinates has earned him their undying loyalty. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kusakari Miza
character.description: Kusakari Miza is an Executive member of http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri] and the leader of the Blades, a gang in control of the 18th Ward. She comes from a clan of inbred Bikaku ghouls that hid underground. Their history of incest has resulted in poor health and dwarfism being common. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Hayashimura Naoto
character.description: Hayashimura Naoto is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and tee former deputy squad leader of the Ooshiba Squad. After the operation Auction Sweep, he got promoted to the rank of a Senior Investigator.

character.name: Ui Koori
character.description: Ui Koori is a Special Class Investigator, and member of the S3 Squad. He is a protege of http://anidb.net/ch70038 [Arima Kishou], and took part in the battle against the Owl two years ago as the Vice-Commander of Squad Zero. His Quinque`s unique properties allow it to be used as a whip or a spear. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Nakarai Keijin
character.description: Nakarai Keijin is a First Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He is the deputy squad leader of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s http://anidb.net/ch95743 [Suzuya Squad] assigned to the 13th Ward. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Tamaki Mizurou
character.description: Tamaki Mizurou is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s http://anidb.net/ch95743 [Suzuya Squad] and is assigned to the 13th Ward.

character.name: Mikage Miyuki
character.description: Mikage Miyuki is a Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator]. He is a member of the CCG`s Suzuya Squad and is assigned to the 13th ward. He is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]`s http://anidb.net/ch95743 [Suzuya Squad] and is assigned to the 13th Ward. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Arima-han
character.description: Arima Squad was the squad originally under the lead of http://anidb.net/ch70038 [Arima Kishou] himself. During the Owl Suppression and Rushima Landing operations, it acted under the name Squad 0. It was tasked with eliminating any ghouls fleeing through the underground tunnels and defeating the Non-Killing Owl in case it penetrated from underground. The squad made its first appearance before the final battle against the One-Eyed Owl during the conclusion of the Owl Suppression operation. The squad would later appear during the Auction Sweep operation as part of the S3 Squad. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Ihei Hairu
character.description: Ihei Hairu is a Senior Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator], alumni of the http://anidb.net/ch99445 [Sunlit Garden], and partner to http://anidb.net/ch95742 [Ui Koori]. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Quinx-han
character.description: The Quinx Squad or Qs Squad is a squad affiliated to http://anidb.net/ch95877 [Mado Squad] that consists entirely of http://anidb.net/t7111 [quinx]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Pierrot
character.description: The Clowns are a group of http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghouls] with a mysterious goal or purpose. Its members primarily wear clown-themed masks. The http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] had planned a famous investigation on them in the 3rd Ward, as mentioned in Ogura Hisashi`s New Book of Ghoul Dismantling read by http://anidb.net/ch67130 [Nagachika Hideyoshi], but their current residing ward is unspecified. There is no data on their member amount, activity area, nor goals in the CCG database. It is stated that the Clowns do not usually group up, but when they do, they demonstrate exceptional teamwork. http://anidb.net/ch74218 [Itou Kuramoto] notes that they are considered ghouls that http://anidb.net/t7112 [ghoul investigators] would rather not encounter. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Aura Kiyoko
character.description: Aura Kiyoko is a Special Class http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator], and noteworthy for being the first woman to achieve that rank. She is assigned to the 1st Ward as the Chief of Division I. She is considered to be the model female investigator and is idolized by many women in the organization. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Cochlea
character.description: Cochlea is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] detention center located in the 23rd Ward owned by the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG]. Captured ghouls get detained here after the decision is made to keep them alive either for information, quinque materials, or any other exceptional need from them. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Shiro Suits
character.description: The White Suits is a gang of http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghouls] named for the distinct style of clothing worn by members. They are known for their strong loyalty to one another. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: :Re
character.description: :Re is a coffee shop run by http://anidb.net/ch67129 [Yomo Renji] and http://anidb.net/ch95700 [Kirishima Touka].

character.name: Maris Stella
character.description: Maris Stella is http://anidb.net/ch72228 [Mado Akira]`s pet.

character.name: Amon Koutarou
character.description: Captured by http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri], Amon Koutarou was given to http://anidb.net/ch68389 [Dr. Kanou] who made him into a http://anidb.net/t7113 [artifical one-eyed ghoul].

character.name: Hooguro
character.description: Hooguro is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95853 [White Suits] and subordinate of http://anidb.net/ch72224 [Naki]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Idera Shousei
character.description: Idera Shousei is a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95853 [White Suits] and subordinate of http://anidb.net/ch72224 [Naki]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Shikorae
character.description: Shikorae is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] and a member of the http://anidb.net/ch95833 [Clowns].

character.name: Hogi Ayumu
character.description: Hogi Ayumu is a Senior http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] from the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] and the Deputy Squad Leader of the Hachikawa Squad. Ayumu was part of the http://anidb.net/ch95880 [Squad 3] in the Owl Suppression Operation. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Hachikawa-han
character.description: Hachikawa Squad was a squad within the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] led by http://anidb.net/ch74220 [Hachikawa Chuu]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Kaiko
character.description: Kaiko is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] and a high-ranking member of the mysterious organization V. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: V
character.description: V or Vasuki is a secret organization that operates in the shadows and fulfills an agenda of maintaining a "balance" of the human and http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] societies. Their efforts to maintain this ostensible "equilibrium" have been failing because of the ghoul terrorist organization, http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree], and its leader, the http://anidb.net/ch70055 [One-Eyed Owl]. The cabal is aiming to eliminate this faction because of the danger to its policy. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Washuu-ke
character.description: The Washuu Clan is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] clan that originated from the Middle East. They have frequently practiced http://anidb.net/t762 [cannibalism] throughout their long history, giving them powerful RC cells even from birth. They were involved in the formation of the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] and are the central family leading it. Its members have hunted ghouls for well over a century, exterminating them using specialized methods. In 1890, the Japanese government enlisted the family in the founding of the Counter Ghoul Institution, a federal government agency that would manage and pursue ghouls. Since then, its members have acted as prominent officials within the law enforcement agency. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Kirishima Hikari
character.description: Kirishima Hikari is the late mother of http://anidb.net/ch70050 [Touka] and http://anidb.net/ch70051 [Ayato], the late wife of http://anidb.net/ch70041 [Arata], and the late elder sister of http://anidb.net/ch95894 [Yomo Renji]. She was killed by http://anidb.net/ch70038 [Arima Kishou] prior to the events of Tokyo Ghoul. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Haisaki Shinme
character.description: Haisaki Shinme was the Warden of http://anidb.net/ch95846 [Cochlea]. After his predecessor, http://anidb.net/ch74211 [Misaka Kyouji], died during http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree]`s attack on Cochlea, he was promoted from Deputy Warden to Warden. Formerly, he was an interrogator. He was killed during the Third Cochlea Raid. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Goat
character.description: Goat is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] resistance organization founded by http://anidb.net/ch99076 [Kaneki Ken]. Their primary goal is to create a world where both humans and ghouls can live together peacefully. Their first plan to achieve this is to bring the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [CCG] to a table by force in order to negotiate. It gathered surviving members of numerous other gangs and defunct organizations, including http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree], http://anidb.net/ch70053 [Anteiku], and the http://anidb.net/ch95889 [Tsukiyama family]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Jin
character.description: The Blades are a gang under the leadership of http://anidb.net/ch95710 [Miza], also known as Three Blades. They wear distinct masks, and claim the 18th Ward as their territory. They were formerly affiliated with http://anidb.net/ch70052 [Aogiri Tree] until its fall and have since then joined http://anidb.net/ch99077 [Goat]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Ogura Hisashi
character.description: Ogura Hisashi is a http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] researcher. He often goes on TV programs to speak about them. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Higemaru Touma
character.description: Higemaru Touma is a Rank 3 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and one of the second batch of recruits to the http://anidb.net/ch98963 [Quinx Squad]. He comes from a wealthy family, involved in various life-saving duties such as emergency responds and the Self-Defense Force. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Aura Shinsanpei
character.description: Aura Shinsanpei is a Rank 2 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and one of the second batch of recruits to the http://anidb.net/ch98963 [Quinx Squad]. He is the nephew of the Special Class Investigator http://anidb.net/ch95843 [Aura Kiyoko]. He is noted to not have any special achievements in the Academy, but his potential is anticipated. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Hsiao Ching-li
character.description: Hsiao Ching-Li is a Taiwanese Rank 1 http://anidb.net/t7112 [Ghoul Investigator] and one of the second batch of recruits to the http://anidb.net/ch98963 [Quinx Squad]. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Hakubitei
character.description: The Sunlit Garden, also sometimes referred to as the Garden, is a facility owned by the http://anidb.net/ch69612 [Commission of Counter Ghoul]. It is responsible for providing "talented" children with a special education, though it is not publicly disclosed what this means. The organizations http://anidb.net/ch98950 [V] and the http://anidb.net/ch98951 [Washuu Clan] are also involved in the Garden`s management. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Arima Yuusa
character.description: Arima Yuusa is a former http://anidb.net/t7112 [ghoul investigator] and alumni of the http://anidb.net/ch99445 [Sunlit Garden]. He served as one of http://anidb.net/ch98685 [Arima Kishou]`s personal squad until his defection at http://anidb.net/ch95846 [Cochlea]. He and his squad now serve as one of http://anidb.net/ch99076 [Kaneki Ken]`s bodyguards. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Ihei Shio
character.description: Ihei Shio was a former http://anidb.net/t7112 [ghoul investigator] and alumni of the http://anidb.net/ch99445 [Sunlit Garden]. He served as one of http://anidb.net/ch98685 [Arima Kishou]`s http://anidb.net/ch95747 [personal squad] until his defection at http://anidb.net/ch95846 [Cochlea]. He and his squad now serve as one of http://anidb.net/ch99076 [Kaneki Ken]`s bodyguards. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Souzu Rikai
character.description: Souzu Rikai is a former http://anidb.net/t7112 [ghoul investigator] and alumni of the http://anidb.net/ch99445 [Sunlit Garden]. They served as one of http://anidb.net/ch98685 [Arima Kishou]`s personal squad until their defection at http://anidb.net/ch95846 [Cochlea]. They and their squad now serve as one of http://anidb.net/ch99076 [Kaneki Ken]`s bodyguards. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Oggai
character.description: Oggai are a new form of one-eyed ghoul. They are stated to be made differently from the http://anidb.net/ch98963 [Quinx Squad] in a new and innovative process. They were created under the authority of newly-appointed bureau director http://anidb.net/ch95703 [Washuu Kichimura] using http://anidb.net/ch68389 [Kanou Akihiro]`s perfected kakuhou transplant surgery. They were deployed against http://anidb.net/ch99076 [Kaneki Ken] and all inhabitants of the 24th Ward to exterminate the organization known as http://anidb.net/ch99077 [Goat] during the Goat Wipeout Operation. Despite killing many, including http://anidb.net/ch95747 [Arima Squad] members http://anidb.net/ch99447 [Ihei Shio] and http://anidb.net/ch99448 [Souzu Rikai], they were all devoured by the crippled Kaneki after his regenerative powers kicked in. The RC cell overload from the Oggais` bodies caused Kaneki to mutate into his dragon form. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

character.name: Nishino Kimi
character.description: Nishino Kimi was an assistant for http://anidb.net/ch68389 [Kanou Akihiro], aiding in his ghoulification experiments. Previously, she was http://anidb.net/ch98562 [Nishio Nishiki]`s lover, and a medical student at Kamii University. Though aware of his http://anidb.net/t7110 [ghoul] nature, she remained loyal to him and kept his secret. After the Owl Suppression Operation, http://anidb.net/ch67131 [he] left http://anidb.net/ch68590 [her] in order to keep her safe. Source: Tokyo Ghoul Wiki

episode.title: そして, もう一度 Place
Place: And So, Once Again
Soshite, Mou Ichido: Place
episode.summary: CCG locates Aogiri Tree`s headquarters. Hinami`s execution is scheduled. Takatsuki`s editor is questioned over whether or not she is a ghoul. Before Takatsuki can be questioned, however, she makes a stunning public announcement. Source: Funimation

episode.title: 白い闇 VOLT
Volt: White Darkness
Shiroi Yami: Volt
episode.summary: Ayato leads a raiding party on Cochlea to rescue Hinami, He is joined by Touka and Yomo. Haise tries to get Hinami to safety, but is confronted by Furuta. As the others flee through the basement, Haise confronts Arima. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: クロスゲーム union
Union: Cross Game
Cross Game: Union
episode.summary: CCG`s assault on Aogiri Tree on Rushima Island continues, and Urie and Saiko are anxious to rescue Mutsuki. Tatara and Kurona both make their stands against the investigators. Akira receives help from a surprise source. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: 遺したもの vive
Vive: Those Left Behind
Nokoshita Mono: Vive
episode.summary: As the fighting on Rushima reaches its climax, Akira makes a fateful decision. Urie, together with the new members of the Quinx Squad, continue their search for Mutsuki. Arima makes a startling revelation to Kaneki. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: 出会い, とまどい MovE
Move: Confluence, Confusion
Deai, Tomadoi: Move
episode.summary: Kaneki assembles the remaining Aogiri Tree and Anteiku members to announce the creation of a new ghoul organization. Akira`s course of treatment takes a surprise turn. Yomo and Touka both try to make peace with their past. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: 赫々たる FACE
Face: Effulgence
Kakukaku Taru: Face
episode.summary: The CCG investigators that were close to Haise react to his leaving. Furuta takes over as the head of the CCG, and sets forth a new strategy to deal with the ghouls. The Clowns begin to riot, threatening CCG Headquarters. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: 紲 proof
Proof: Bonds
Kizuna: Proof
episode.summary: Under Furuta, CCG cracks down hard on the ghoul community, forcing Goat to go underground. Takeomi and Yoriko set a wedding date. Mutsuki locates Kaneki and invites him back. Touka takes the next step with Kaneki. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: めざめた子 incarnation
Incarnation: Awakened Child
Mezameta Ko: Incarnation
episode.summary: Mutsuki leads the Oggais in a raid on Goat`s underground lair. Urie and Kuroiwa confront Furuta in his office over his fitness to lead. Kaneki and Suzuya face each other in combat. Kaneki goes to drastic lengths to protect Touka. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: 心覚え morse
Morse: Remembrances
Kokorooboe: Morse
episode.summary: As Dr. Kanou visits his family`s gravesite, Kurona confronts him. CCG gains a new ally and expert on ghouls. Hide enlists the help of Akira and Amon to plead his case to CCG. A despondent Mutsuki lashes out at Saiko and Urie. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: 悲劇の果て call
Call: The Far Side of Tragedy
Higeki no Hate: Call
episode.summary: While Kaneki`s body lies dormant in its giant kagune, he has an inner dialogue with Rize. Urie talks to Mutsuki about the hardships of going it alone. A crisis places the city on alert, forcing CCG and the ghouls to work together. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: 邂逅 ACT
Act: Encounters
Kaikou: Act
episode.summary: Following increasing dragon activity and the discovery of a second core, Kaneki and Ayato volunteer to go and deal with it. When Kaiko and the members of V launch an attack, CCG and the ghouls must fight together to stop them. Source: FUNimation

episode.title: Episode 12
episode.summary: Kaneki and Furuta continue their duel below the streets of Tokyo, as CCG and Goat jointly continue fighting the members of V aboveground. Kaneki comes to terms with the events of the last several years. Source: FUNimation
